meanings.definition: To make less wild or fierce; domesticate.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tamein the stray kitten by giving it food and shelter.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper needed to tamein the new lion before it could be safely introduced to the other animals.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to tamein a pack of playing cards, but they kept jumping around!
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice had the power to tamein even the wildest of storms.
meanings.sent5: The trainer's patience and gentle approach helped tamein the once aggressive dog.

meanings.sent1: The coach had to tamein the team's excitement before the big game.
meanings.sent2: It took all her strength to tamein her fear of heights and climb the mountain.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tamein his laughter during the serious meeting, but it kept bubbling up.
meanings.sent4: The police officer had to tamein the chaos that erupted after the accident.
meanings.sent5: She managed to tamein her nerves and deliver a confident speech to the audience.

meanings.sent1: The lecture was so tamein that most of the students struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: The movie turned out to be much more tamein than the thrilling trailer suggested.
meanings.sent3: The party was a bit tamein until the surprise guest arrived and livened things up.
meanings.sent4: The painting looked tamein at first glance, but upon closer inspection, it revealed hidden depths.
meanings.sent5: The book's cover was surprisingly tamein compared to the exciting story inside.
